description: Unique code identifying a fleet location (shop, site, or area) used across work orders, assets, and inventory transactions.
Short, user-friendly name of the location shown in lists and reports.
Free-text internal notes about the location.
Numeric hierarchy level of the location within the location tree; lower numbers typically represent higher tiers.
Code of the parent location that groups this location in the hierarchy.
Primary street address line of the location.
Secondary address line, such as building, suite, or unit.
City for the location’s address.
State or province for the location’s address.
Postal code for the location’s address.
Nearest cross street or intersection for navigation or dispatch.
Geographic latitude in decimal degrees (WGS84) for mapping and routing.
Geographic longitude in decimal degrees (WGS84) for mapping and routing.
Elevation above sea level for the location; unit depends on system configuration (confirm with SME).
Extended description or directions providing more detail about the location.
Identifier of the user or process that created the record.
Date and time when the record was created.
Identifier of the user or process that last updated the record.
Date and time of the most recent update.
Identifier linking this location to related attachments or documents; likely a foreign key to an attachments entity (confirm with SME).
Street number component of the address, stored separately to support geocoding or formatting.
Street name component of the address, stored separately to support geocoding or formatting.
Boolean indicator showing whether the location is active and available for operational use.
